en: Three years have passed since he died.
zh: 他去世三年了。

en: With his death, the oldest family in this village died out.
zh: 随着他的去世，这个村子里最古老的家族就此绝迹了。

en: Ten years have passed since he died.
zh: 他去世十年了。

en: He's been dead ten years.
zh: 他已经走了十年了。

en: It's been ten years since he died.
zh: 他去世已经有十年了。

en: She still hated him, even after he died.
zh: 就算他死了，她还是恨他。

en: It has been ten years since he died.
zh: 他都去世十年了。

en: He has been dead for three years.
zh: 他去世已经三年了。

en: The evening he died was stormy.
zh: 他去世的那天晚上风雨交加。

en: It was yesterday that he died.
zh: 他是昨天去世的。

en: It is a great pity he was given up for lost.
zh: 真可惜，大家都以为他已经没救了。

en: I was surprised at the news of his death.
zh: 听到他去世的消息，我很惊讶。

en: The news that he died was a shock to me.
zh: 他去世的消息让我很震惊。

en: The news of his death spread abroad.
zh: 他去世的消息传到了国外。

en: The news of his death spread.
zh: 他去世的消息传开了。

en: The news of his death spread around.
zh: 他去世的消息传得到处都是。

en: What will become of the children after his death?
zh: 他死后，那些孩子该怎么办呢？

en: The estate went to his daughter when he died.
zh: 他死后，遗产都归他女儿了。

en: He is actually not the manager.
zh: 其实他并不是经理。

en: It is not surprising that he was elected mayor.
zh: 他当选市长一点也不奇怪。

en: I've known him ever since he was a child.
zh: 我从小就认识他。

en: Let's wait here until he turns up.
zh: 咱们在这儿等他出现吧。

en: He is certain to turn up.
zh: 他肯定会露面的。

en: I thought it strange that he didn't turn up.
zh: 我觉得他没出现挺奇怪的。

en: I thought it was strange that he didn't turn up.
zh: 我当时觉得他没来挺奇怪的。

en: His constant complaints aroused my rage.
zh: 他没完没了的抱怨把我惹火了。

en: There must be something wrong with the pen he is using.
zh: 他用的那支笔肯定有问题。

en: I am certain that he will quit his job.
zh: 我敢肯定他会辞职的。

en: He has every reason to quit his job.
zh: 他完全有理由辞职。

en: I don't care whether he agrees or not.
zh: 我不在乎他同不同意。

en: It is uncertain whether he will agree or not.
zh: 还不确定他会不会同意。

en: It makes no difference whether he agrees or not.
zh: 他同不同意都一个样。

en: It doesn't matter whether he agrees or not.
zh: 他同不同意都无所谓。

en: He fell in with a strange man when he was taking a walk.
zh: 他散步的时候碰到了一个怪人。

en: Whether he agrees or not, we won't change our plans.
zh: 不管他同不同意，我们都不会改变计划。

en: I read in the newspaper that he had been murdered.
zh: 我在报纸上看到他被谋杀了。

en: It is doubtless that he was murdered.
zh: 毫无疑问，他是被谋杀的。

en: There is no doubt that he was murdered.
zh: 肯定是他被谋杀了。

en: What he told me yesterday is a white lie.
zh: 他昨天跟我说的是个善意的谎言。

en: What he said yesterday is not true.
zh: 他昨天说的不是真话。

en: What he said yesterday is not consistent with what he had said last week.
zh: 他昨天说的跟上礼拜说的不一样。

en: He came to see you yesterday.
zh: 他昨天来找过你。

en: He came yesterday to see you.
zh: 他是昨天过来找你的。

en: The fish he caught yesterday is still alive.
zh: 他昨天钓的那条鱼还活着的。

en: He cannot have been there yesterday.
zh: 他昨天不可能在那儿。

en: His paper plane was fragile.
zh: 他的纸飞机很不结实。

en: I must make sure whether he is at home or not.
zh: 我得确认一下他在不在家。

en: There is no room to doubt that he is a gifted artist.
zh: 毫无疑问，他是个有天赋的艺术家。

en: There is no doubt about his ability.
zh: 他的能力是毋庸置疑的。

en: His boast that he is the best pitcher is true.
zh: 他自夸是最好的投手，这话倒是一点不假。

en: He was the first to come.
zh: 他是第一个来的。

en: He came first.
zh: 他第一个到的。

en: He was the first person to arrive.
zh: 他是第一个到的人。

en: He was the first to arrive.
zh: 他是第一个到的。

en: What he needs most is a good job.
zh: 他最需要的是一份好工作。

en: His reelection seems sure.
zh: 他连任看来是稳了。

en: The dinner he ate this evening was inferior in quality to that dinner.
zh: 他今晚吃的这顿饭没上次那顿好。

en: It is no laughing matter that he couldn't graduate from university this year.
zh: 他今年没法从大学毕业，这可不是闹着玩的。

en: Do you know the reason why he cut class today?
zh: 你知道他今天为什么逃课吗？

en: Do you know why he skipped class today?
zh: 你知道他今天为什么翘课吗？

en: I don't know the reason he is absent today.
zh: 我不知道他今天为什么没来。

en: What he is today he owes to his father.
zh: 他能有今天，全靠他父亲。

en: Sport has made him what he is.
zh: 运动成就了现在的他。

en: You should read such a good book as he is reading now.
zh: 你应该读读他现在正在看的那种好书。

en: I don't know if he will visit us next Sunday.
zh: 我不知道他下周日会不会来看我们。

en: I am uncertain when he will come next.
zh: 我不确定他下次什么时候来。

en: We were surprised when we saw him in the office this morning.
zh: 今天早上在办公室看见他，我们都挺惊讶的。

en: Where he will live doesn't interest us.
zh: 他住哪儿我们不感兴趣。

en: It is certain that he is in Hawaii now.
zh: 可以肯定他现在在夏威夷。

en: We are worried about where he is now.
zh: 我们挺担心他现在人在哪儿的。

en: Make certain where he is now.
zh: 确认一下他现在人在哪儿。

en: I know nothing as to where he is now.
zh: 他现在在哪儿，我一点儿都不知道。

en: I wish he were here now.
zh: 要是他现在在这儿就好了。

en: I copied in my notebook whatever he wrote on the blackboard.
zh: 他在黑板上写什么，我就在笔记本上记什么。

en: He hasn't been heard from since he left the country.
zh: 他出国之后就没消息了。

en: I would like to have seen him before he left the country.
zh: 他出国前我要是能见见他就好了。

en: It is doubtful whether he will pass.
zh: 他能不能过还不好说。

en: His success delighted his parents.
zh: 他的成功让他父母很高兴。

en: I don't care whether he leaves or stays.
zh: 他走还是留我无所谓。

en: It is definite that he will go.
zh: 他肯定会去的。

en: It is advisable for him to go.
zh: 建议他还是去一下比较好。

en: The dog followed him wherever he went.
zh: 不管他去哪儿，那只狗都跟着他。

en: It is Egypt that he wants to visit.
zh: 他想去的地方是埃及。

en: I know quite clearly what he thinks.
zh: 我很清楚他在想什么。

en: I understand him to be happy.
zh: 我看他过得挺开心的。

en: I like him.
zh: 我喜欢他。

en: It is evident that he has made a mistake.
zh: 很明显，他犯了个错。

en: I can't understand what he is trying to say.
zh: 我听不明白他想表达什么。

en: What he says sounds very sensible to me.
zh: 我觉得他说得很有道理。

en: What he is saying doesn't make sense.
zh: 他说的话根本没道理。

en: I got the gist of what he was saying.
zh: 我听懂了他说话的大概意思。

en: What he said was to the contrary.
zh: 他说的刚好相反。

en: Everything he said was right.
zh: 他说的每一句都是对的。

en: Only a few understood what he said.
zh: 只有几个人听懂了他说了什么。

en: I remember what he said.
zh: 我记得他说了什么。

en: Do you believe what he said?
zh: 你信他说的话吗？

en: Do tell me what he said.
zh: 快告诉我他说了什么。

en: What he said turned out to be true.
zh: 结果证明他说的是真的。

en: What he has said is true of them.
zh: 他说的情况在他们身上也是一样的。

en: What he said is not true.
zh: 他说的不是真话。

en: What he said then shocked me.
zh: 他当时说的话吓到我了。

en: What he said was by no means true.
zh: 他说的话绝不是真的。

en: What he said is, in a sense, true.
zh: 他说的话，从某种意义上来说，是真的。

en: Some of the things he said got under my skin.
zh: 他说的有些话让我很不爽。

en: Don't take any notice of what he said.
zh: 别把他的话当回事。

en: I cannot understand what he is driving at.
zh: 我搞不懂他到底想表达什么。

en: He says firefighting is a feast or famine job.
zh: 他说当消防员不是忙得要命，就是闲得发慌。

en: Few students could understand what he said.
zh: 没几个学生能听懂他说的话。

en: Admitting what he says, I still think that he is in the wrong.
zh: 就算承认他说得对，我还是觉得他错了。

en: What he says is false.
zh: 他说的是假话。

en: Whatever he says is true.
zh: 不管他说什么都是真的。

en: All that he says is true.
zh: 他说的全是真话。

en: I think it's true that he wasn't at the scene.
zh: 我觉得他当时确实不在现场。

en: I have no idea where he is at present.
zh: 我现在根本不知道他在哪。

en: There was an awkward silence when he appeared.
zh: 他出现的时候，气氛一度变得很尴尬。

en: His appearance animated the party.
zh: 他的出现让派对热闹了起来。

en: When he appeared, the party livened up.
zh: 他一露面，派对就活跃起来了。

en: We were talking about him when he appeared.
zh: 我们正聊着他呢，他就出现了。

en: When he turned up, we had been waiting for two hours.
zh: 他出现时，我们已经等了两个小时了。

en: When he went out the front door, the bus was just coming around the corner.
zh: 他走出前门时，公车正好转过弯来。

en: I am no more intelligent than he.
zh: 我不比他聪明。

en: It is not clear whether he is wise or not.
zh: 还不清楚他到底明不明智。

en: I'm sure that he is clever.
zh: 我肯定他很聪明。

en: He was seen to enter the building.
zh: 有人看见他进了那栋楼。

en: The box he found was empty.
zh: 他找到的那个盒子是空的。

en: It was a miracle that he recovered.
zh: 他能康复简直是个奇迹。

en: His good health is attributed to getting plenty of sleep.
zh: 他身体好是因为睡眠充足。

en: It's been ten years since they were married.
zh: 他们结婚已经十年了。

en: How did you know that he is married?
zh: 你怎么知道他结婚了？

en: The woman whom he married is very beautiful.
zh: 他娶的老婆非常漂亮。

en: The woman he married is very beautiful.
zh: 他娶的老婆长得真漂亮。

en: It is not you but her that he wants to marry.
zh: 他想娶的不是你，而是她。

en: It's just possible that he'll eventually recover the use of his legs.
zh: 他的腿最终还是有可能恢复功能的。

en: I am convinced that he is innocent.
zh: 我确信他是无辜的。

en: I am impatient with his inability to make decisions.
zh: 我受不了他那优柔寡断的样子。

en: I can't account for his absence.
zh: 我解释不了他为什么没来。

en: It came out that what he had told the police was not true.
zh: 结果发现他跟警察说的全是假话。

en: Don't you know he is enraged at your insult?
zh: 你不知道你的侮辱让他很生气吗？

en: The reason he refused your offer is obvious.
zh: 他拒绝你提议的原因很明显。

en: No wonder he refused your offer.
zh: 难怪他拒绝了你的提议。

en: I bet that he'll accept your proposal.
zh: 我敢打赌他会接受你的提议。

en: It is certain that he will agree to your plan.
zh: 他肯定会同意你的计划。

en: Don't count on him to lend you any money.
zh: 别指望他能借钱给你。

en: He cannot have told you a wrong number.
zh: 他不可能告诉你错的号码。

en: Were he to see you, he would be surprised.
zh: 要是他见到你，肯定会大吃一惊。

en: Whatever he asks you, you mustn't answer.
zh: 不管他问你什么，你都千万别回答。

en: The police suspect that he robbed the bank.
zh: 警察怀疑他抢了银行。

en: It is clear that he is rich.
zh: 显然他很有钱。

en: I never counted on his being rich.
zh: 我从没指望过他会有钱。

en: Because he is rich, it doesn't follow that he is happy.
zh: 虽说他有钱，但并不代表他过得开心。

en: Just because he's rich, doesn't mean he's happy.
zh: 有钱不代表就开心。

en: It's clear that he stole money from the safe.
zh: 很明显，保险柜里的钱就是他偷的。

en: I caught him stealing the money.
zh: 我抓到他在偷钱。

en: Some new books were added to the library at his expense.
zh: 图书馆添了些新书，都是他出钱买的。

en: We congratulated him on winning a gold medal.
zh: 我们祝贺他拿到了金牌。

en: We cried banzai at the news that he won the gold medal.
zh: 听说他拿了金牌，我们都欢呼了起来。

en: He moved into my neighborhood.
zh: 他搬到我家附近住了。

en: I have a feeling that he may blow in sometime soon.
zh: 我觉得他可能快要突然冒出来了。

en: He was right to give up smoking.
zh: 他把烟戒了是对的。

en: To his surprise, the thief turned out to be his own son.
zh: 让他没想到的是，小偷竟然是他儿子。

en: To his amazement, the door opened all by itself.
zh: 让他吃惊的是，门竟然自己开了。

en: To his surprise, the train made a quick stop.
zh: 让他意外的是，火车突然停了一下。

en: His threat got me to start studying seriously.
zh: 因为他的威胁，我开始认真学习了。

en: When he shouted, the veins in his neck stood out clearly.
zh: 他喊的时候，脖子上的青筋都爆出来了。

en: I stayed there until he had left.
zh: 我一直待到他走了才离开。

en: After he left, she started feeling uneasy.
zh: 他走后，她就开始觉得不安了。

en: I was pleased with the rapidity with which he mastered Japanese.
zh: 他学日语学得这么快，我挺高兴的。

en: Now that he is absent, I will have to work in his place.
zh: 既然他不在，我就得顶替他的工作了。

en: The reason he was absent was that he had a severe headache.
zh: 他没来是因为头疼得厉害。

en: His absence was due to illness.
zh: 他生病了，所以没来。

en: It is best that he should do his duty.
zh: 他最好能尽到自己的责任。

en: When he came to, he was lying in the park.
zh: 他醒过来的时候，发现自己正躺在公园里。

en: I saw at once that he was ill at ease.
zh: 我一眼就看出他很不自在。

en: Upon returning home, he found a letter in the mailbox.
zh: 他一回到家，就发现信箱里有一封信。

en: I suggested to her that we go to the movies after he came home.
zh: 我跟她提议等他回家了再一起去看电影。

en: I was just going to write a letter when he came home.
zh: 我正准备写信呢，他就回来了。

en: The sun had already set when he got home.
zh: 他到家的时候，太阳都已经下山了。

en: It was because he was sick that he decided to return home.
zh: 就是因为生病了，他才决定回家的。

en: It was because he was ill that he decided to return home.
zh: 他是因为身体不舒服才决定回家的。

en: When he was leaving, he told me that he would come again by the 25th.
zh: 他走的时候说，25号之前会再来。

en: It will have stopped raining by the time he comes back.
zh: 等他回来的时候，雨应该已经停了。

en: Let's leave as soon as he gets back.
zh: 他一回来我们就走吧。

en: He came back, and it rained soon.
zh: 他刚回来没多久就下雨了。

en: It rained as soon as he got home.
zh: 他一到家就下雨了。

en: I'll wait here till he comes back.
zh: 我就在这儿等他回来。

en: Let's leave things as they are until he comes back.
zh: 先保持现状，等他回来再说吧。

en: Let's start after he comes home.
zh: 等他回家后我们再开始。

en: As soon as he comes back, let me know.
zh: 他一回来就告诉我一声。

en: Will you tell him about it when he comes home?
zh: 等他回家，你能把这件事告诉他吗？

en: He came back not because he was homesick, but because he was running short of money.
zh: 他回来不是因为想家，而是因为快没钱了。

en: I remember the time when he returned.
zh: 我还记得他回来的那个时候。

en: Look at the book which he put on the desk.
zh: 看看他放在桌子上的那本书。

en: It's obvious that he's in the wrong.
zh: 很明显是他错了。

en: It's obvious that he's wrong.
zh: 显然是他不对。

en: It's obvious he's wrong.
zh: 谁都看得出他错了。

en: It is plain that he is wrong.
zh: 很清楚，就是他错了。

en: It is certain that he is wrong.
zh: 他肯定错了。

en: He is the minister responsible for the environment.
zh: 他是负责环境方面的部长。

en: Little did I imagine he would achieve a perfect game.
zh: 我怎么也没想到他能打出一场完美的比赛。

en: The vase broken by him is my aunt's.
zh: 被他打碎的那个花瓶是我姑姑的。

en: The vase that he broke is my aunt's.
zh: 他弄碎的那个花瓶是我阿姨的。

en: The vase he broke is my aunt's.
zh: 他打碎的那个花瓶是我阿姨的。

en: It was a glass that he broke.
zh: 他打破的是个玻璃杯。

en: It's such a long time since he left school.
zh: 他离开学校已经好久了。

en: It is by this reason that he left school.
zh: 他就是因为这个原因才退学的。

en: It is for this reason that he left school.
zh: 他就是因为这个原因才退学的。

en: It is strange for him to be absent from school.
zh: 他没去上学挺奇怪的。

en: It is because his mother is ill that he cannot come to school.
zh: 就是因为他妈妈生病了，他才没法来上学。

en: It is only natural that he should do well at school.
zh: 他在学校表现好也是理所当然的。

en: He can't have gone to school.
zh: 他不可能去学校了。

en: He can not have gone to school.
zh: 他绝对没去上学。

en: He found that the things he had studied in school were not useful in the business world.
zh: 他发现学校里学的东西在商场上根本没用。

en: He argued that nuclear weapons were a threat to peace.
zh: 他主张核武器威胁到了和平。

en: Did you see him go out?
zh: 你看见他出去了吗？

en: He is in charge of entertaining the foreign guests.
zh: 他负责招待外宾。

en: I helped him out with his picture.
zh: 我帮他一起画了那幅画。

en: It was not until he was forty that he started to paint pictures.
zh: 他直到四十岁才开始画画。

en: We heard him come downstairs.
zh: 我们听见他下楼了。

en: I heard him go down the stairs.
zh: 我听见他走下楼了。

en: Just because he likes painting doesn't mean he's good at painting.
zh: 就算他喜欢画画，也不代表他画得好。

en: Just because he likes painting doesn't mean he's good at it.
zh: 就算他喜欢画画，也不代表他擅长。

en: I can hardly imagine him going abroad.
zh: 我很难想象他出国的样子。

en: It's true that he saw a monster.
zh: 他的确看到怪兽了。

en: I am suspicious of him.
zh: 我对他有点怀疑。

en: It is this window that he broke.
zh: 他打碎的就是这扇窗户。

en: It's even chances that he will get well.
zh: 他康复的可能性也就一半一半吧。

en: There is little hope that he will recover.
zh: 他康复的希望很渺茫。

en: Is there any prospect of his recovering?
zh: 他还有康复的可能吗？

en: Is there any chance that he'll recover?
zh: 他还有机会康复吗？

en: Is there any chance of his recovery?
zh: 他康复的机会大吗？

en: I had hoped that he would recover.
zh: 我本希望他能康复的。

en: There is little if any hope for his recovery.
zh: 他康复的希望就算有也极其渺茫。

en: There is no reason why he should be dismissed.
zh: 没理由开除他啊。

en: It is strange for him to be dismissed.
zh: 他被开除挺奇怪的。

en: There are rumors in the air that he was fired.
zh: 有传闻说他被炒了。

en: He made a speech on behalf of our company.
zh: 他代表我们公司做了个演讲。

en: Everyone knows that he worked hard to get to the top of the company.
zh: 谁都知道他为了爬到公司高层有多拼。

en: He persuaded his firm to let him go back to his old job.

en: I see no reason why he doesn't relate to the firm.

en: What do you think has become of him?

en: Do you know why he has been absent from school?

en: Who knows what has become of him?

en: I cannot understand why he left so suddenly.

en: Do you know what has become of him?

en: He can not have done that.

en: It was yesterday that he went there.

en: He does so not because he hates you, but because he loves you.

en: It will be a long time before he has fully recovered.

en: There is no hope of his getting well soon.

en: I suggested that he go there at once.

en: It took him several weeks to recover from the shock.

en: He comes back from Sydney today.

en: What he did was nothing less than madness.

en: The wind he gave off smells.

en: His fart smelled.

en: It'll be a pity if he fails.

en: That he should behave like this!

en: It is odd that he is so late.

en: He can't have written this; it's not his handwriting.

en: He can't have read this book.

en: It is said that he wrote this book.

en: He must have entered this room.

en: He laid out this garden.

en: It is easy for him to answer this question.

en: He is the master of this house.

en: I saw him come this way.

en: I observed him come along here.

en: Whether he comes or not, either way I will inform you.

en: Hard work has carried him this far.

en: A year has passed since he came here.

en: I'll tell him so when he comes here.

en: I don't know when he'll be here.

en: It is certain that he will come here.

en: I want to know if he'll come here.

en: Would that he were here to help us.

en: I wish that he were here to help us.

en: I wish that he was here to help us.

en: Let's suppose that he is here.

zh: 在前政权统治下，所有的异见人士都被清算了。

en: Opposition leaders say it's possible the Communists could end up in a small minority.
zh: 反对党领袖说，共产党最终可能会变成少数派。

en: The defiant manner is characteristic of teenagers.
zh: 这种挑衅的态度是青少年的典型特征。

en: Rebellion it always sells at a profit.
zh: 叛逆总是很有市场的。

en: The rebels took control of the capital.
zh: 叛军控制了首都。

en: The rebel was ultimately captured and confined to prison.
zh: 那个叛乱分子最终被抓并关进了监狱。

en: The rebels made a barricade across the road.
zh: 叛军在马路上筑起了路障。

en: The anti-nuclear energy movement is being led by a number of organizations.
zh: 反核运动正由一些组织领导。

en: You'll get brownie points if you respond quickly.
zh: 如果你回得快，会加分的。

en: Half-forgotten music danced through his mind.
zh: 那些快要忘掉的旋律在他脑海中回荡。

en: Give me half of it.
zh: 给我一半。

en: I had a Caesarian section six months ago.
zh: 我半年前做了剖腹产。

en: Six months ago I had an operation for the cataract in my right eye.
zh: 六个月前我做了右眼白内障手术。

en: You must come every six months for a check-up.
zh: 你得每半年过来检查一次。

en: Do you offer any half-day tours?
zh: 你们有半日游吗？

en: I only ride a bicycle at odd times.
zh: 我只是偶尔骑骑自行车。

en: Show me short-sleeved ones, please.
zh: 请给我看下短袖的。

en: Half of the melons were eaten.
zh: 瓜被吃了一半。

en: It rained like mad for about a half-hour.
zh: 雨下得特别大，持续了大概半小时。

en: He will be here in half an hour.
zh: 他半小时后到。

en: The judge bound the spectators to keep quiet.
zh: 法官要求观众保持安静。

en: The judge sentenced him to one year's imprisonment.
zh: 法官判处他一年监禁。

en: The judge was exhausted from the nervous strain.
zh: 法官因为精神压力太大而精疲力竭。

en: The judge laughed in spite of himself.
zh: 法官忍不住笑了。

en: The judge can't stop.
zh: 法官停不下来。

en: Judgement will be given tomorrow.
zh: 明天宣判。

en: The decision was in favor of the defendant.
zh: 判决对被告有利。

en: The judgement was against him.
zh: 判决对他不利。

en: The judgement went against the government.
zh: 判决对政府不利。

en: The pigeon has flown away.
zh: 鸽子飞走了。

en: Thank to a fundamental restructuring, our surplus has swelled threefold.
zh: 多亏了根本性的重组，我们的盈余增加了三倍。

en: Thanks to a fundamental restructuring, our surplus has swelled three-fold.
zh: 多亏了根本性的重组，我们的盈余增加了三倍。

en: Should I have my tooth extracted?
zh: 我需要拔牙吗？

en: Your tooth must be extracted.
zh: 你这颗牙得拔了。

en: Is there any other way besides extraction?
zh: 除了拔牙还有别的办法吗？

en: A lot of my hair has fallen out.
zh: 我掉了好多头发。

en: The fine shall be paid in cash.
zh: 罚款要用现金支付。

en: She resolved not to pay the fine.
zh: 她决定不交罚款。

en: Didn't it ever occur to them that they would be punished?
zh: 难道他们就没想过会受罚吗？

en: A girl came running, with her hair streaming in the wind.
zh: 一个女孩跑了过来，头发在风中飘着。

en: You look nice with your hair short.
zh: 你剪短发挺好看的。

en: Your short hair suits you.
zh: 短发挺适合你的。

en: You had better have your hair cut.
zh: 你最好去剪个头发。

en: I'd like you to cut my hair.
zh: 我想让你帮我剪个头发。

en: I've got to fix my hair.
zh: 我得弄一下头发。

en: You should go and have your hair cut.
zh: 你该去剪头发了。

en: I used a ribbon to tie my hair into a ponytail.
zh: 我用丝带扎了个马尾。

en: I have to comb my hair.
zh: 我得梳梳头。

en: The other boys teased him when he got his hair cut.
zh: 他剪完头发后，别的男生都嘲笑他。

en: I have had my hair cut shoulder length.
zh: 我把头发剪到齐肩长了。

en: They look alike except for the color of their hair.
zh: 除了发色，他们长得挺像的。

en: She touched her hair. It was wet.
zh: 她摸了摸头发，是湿的。

en: Look at the girl whose hair is long.
zh: 看那个长头发的女孩。

en: My hair is greasy.
zh: 我头发油了。

en: My haircut only cost 1,000 yen. That's pretty rare these days. He probably didn't have a license.
zh: 我剪头才花了一千日元，这年头可少见了，理发师估计没证。

en: Just brush your hair.
zh: 梳梳头就行。

en: My hair has grown out.
zh: 我头发长长了。

en: I saw a girl whose hair came down to her waist.
zh: 我看到一个头发长到腰的女孩。

en: My hair is so messy!
zh: 我头发好乱啊！

en: Old words often take on new meanings because of inventions and technology.
zh: 因为新发明和新技术，旧词常会有新的含义。

en: Inventions are born, so to speak, of necessity.
zh: 所谓发明，其实可以说都是被逼出来的。

en: The ingenious man received the prestigious award for the first time.
zh: 那个天才第一次拿到了那个大奖。

en: Please limit your presentation to 30 minutes.
zh: 请把报告控制在三十分钟内。

en: The developing world and the developed world can prevent a war from breaking out by helping each other.
zh: 发展中国家和发达国家通过互相帮助，可以防止战争爆发。

en: Developing countries suffer from difficulties of fiscal problems.
zh: 发展中国家正面临财政困难。

en: The growth in population is very rapid in developing countries.
zh: 发展中国家的人口增长非常快。

en: Good technicians are in short supply in the developing countries.
zh: 发展中国家很缺优秀的技师。

en: Could you wrap it for mailing?
zh: 能帮我把它包一下好寄快递吗？

en: I have a skin eruption.
zh: 我起疹子了。

en: There are only five minutes till the train starts, and she hasn't appeared.
zh: 离火车出发就剩五分钟了，她还没露面。

en: There are only five minutes left till the train leaves and she hasn't appeared.
zh: 离火车开只剩五分钟了，她还没出现。

en: Which is the departure platform?
zh: 哪个是出发站台？

en: If you permit me to speak, I can explain everything.
zh: 如果你准我说两句，我能解释清楚。

en: I am honored that you should ask me to speak.
zh: 您能邀请我发言，我感到很荣幸。

en: Just one part of what he said got picked up by the media and took on a life of its own.
zh: 他说的话里只有一部分被媒体拿去大做文章，结果传得完全变样了。

en: The hikers were all but frozen when they were found.
zh: 那些徒步的人被找到时快被冻死了。

en: Can you read phonetic signs?
zh: 你认识音标吗？

en: Except for pronunciation, everyone can speak good French.
zh: 除了发音，大家的法语都说得挺好。

en: With respect to pronunciation, he was the best of all the students.
zh: 论发音的话，他是所有学生里最好的。

en: Mark the words which you cannot pronounce.
zh: 把你不会读的词标出来。

en: A friend to everybody is a friend to nobody.
zh: 跟谁都是朋友的人，其实跟谁都不是真正的朋友。

en: Don't try to be all things to all men.
zh: 别总想着讨好每一个人。

en: I tried all possible means.
zh: 我想尽了所有办法。

en: We're sunk.
zh: 我们完蛋了。

en: We're up against the wall.
zh: 我们已经走投无路了。

en: You should arrive at school before 8:30.
zh: 你应该在八点半之前到校。

en: He left for England at the beginning of August.
zh: 他八月初动身去英国了。

en: Mr Hata told us on television some interesting stories about various animals.
zh: 秦先生在电视上给我们讲了一些关于各种动物的趣事。

en: He's in his element when working on the farm.
zh: 他在农场干活时最自在。

en: It is interesting to hear from someone in a different field.
zh: 听听不同领域的人分享挺有意思的。
